metadata.title: CVE-2023-6208 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When using X11, text selected by the page using the Selection API waserroneously copied into the primary selection, a temporary storage notunlike the clipboard. *This bug only affects Firefox on X11. Other systemsare unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 120, Firefox ESR <115.5.0, and Thunderbird < 115.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
